[quote name='Souper']what DID Maxmaps do?[/QUOTE]

Producers (in general) are relationship managers, not inter-personal like friends or spouses but professional relationships, such as between artists and programmers, the creative side and the business side and between entities (i.e. business to business) with a 'big picture' mindset.

Beyond the dealing, and product management a producers job is also to manage the unproductive burdens of productive staff. Imagine if a programmer or artist had to drop out of production to negotiate a business licencing deal, this would eat into their time and could be outside of their area of professional expertise. So you have specialists/organisers who make the business as a whole more productive by handling the professional communications.

While Squad (probably) isn't going to go into specifics of Max's responsibilities, he was probably responsible for (or heavily involved in) negotiating license deals (such as the NASA deal for the ARM pack (being able to use likenesses / logo etc) and similar such as use of the ESA iconography), the deal with FT for console development, as well as setting/maintaining development scheduling (if you can remember Max's "black book", which contained a KSP roadmap).

On November 11, 2015 at 11:12 AM, KasperVld said:

Hello everyone,

Today it's my unfortunate task to inform everyone here that Miguel a.k.a. Maxmaps will be leaving Squad this Friday after more than two years of working on the game, bringing a wealth of knowledge and passion to the game's development. We'd like to thank Max for the dedication with which he tackled his ever growing workload. It's safe to say that without Max's input we'd be in a very different place right now, as he played a positive and instrumental role in the development process.

We will miss having him around and wish him the best of luck in the future.

On behalf of everyone at Squad,

Kasper

It feels like everyone who pioneered this game in its early days is leaving, this community has changed a lot since I last frequented this place often
Thank you for everything Miguel! All the best for the future.

It saddens me to hear that Maxmaps is leaving Squad. After everything he's been through with Squad and KSP, I think this is better for both us and squad, and for him as probably he'll have more time for other things in the future and, on the bright side, to do SCIENCE! AND SOME MORE SCIENCE!
